comments:
I've been trying to get Eclipse 2.0 to run on Mandrake 8.2. I've tried both the 
GTK and MOTIF versions, and I've tried the 2.0 release, Integration 20020730, 
and Integration 20020820 builds. The motif error is: 
**************************************************************** 
JVM terminated. Exit code=6 
/usr/java/j2sdk1.4.0_01/bin/java 
-cp /usr/java/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main 
-os linux 
-ws motif 
-arch x86 
-showspash /usr/java/eclipse/eclipse -showspash 600 
**************************************************************** 
 
The GTk errors like this: 
**************************************************************** 
Problems during startup. Check the ".log" file 
in the ".metadata" directory of your workspace. 
**************************************************************** 
 
The log file has this: 
**************************************************************** 
!SESSION ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Aug 26, 2002 15:13:22.120 
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform: 
!STACK 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Widget 
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method) 
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:1576) 
	at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:1748) 
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:266) 
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:249) 
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.createExecutableExtension(PluginDescriptor.java:136) 
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.createExecutableExtension(PluginDescriptor.java:165) 
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:102) 
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderGetRunnable(InternalPlatform.java:461) 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 
	at 
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) 
	at 
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) 
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) 
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.getRunnable(InternalBootLoader.java:440) 
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:771) 
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462) 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 
	at 
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) 
	at 
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) 
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) 
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:248) 
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:698) 
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:534) 
********************************************************************** 
 
I know Mandrake, although RPM compatible, puts files in different places than 
RedHat. Perhaps the .so files are linked to a different path? I'll try 
different JDKs. I really like Eclipse on Windows ...

GG to investigate and advise.  Lower priority if this is a well known problem 
with a well knows solution.

I've never seen this before.  It looks like it's not finding the swt jar.  Can 
you try invoking the eclipse executable from its own directory (ie.-
 "./eclipse -vm ...").  Also, do you definitely have write permission to 
eclipse's install directory?

I recently upgraded to Mandrake 9.0. After Grant Gayed's recent post, I 
downloaded the latest release (Eclipse SDK 2.0.1 GTK). I unzipped as root 
to "/usr/java" then ran (as root) "./eclipse -
vm /usr/java/j2sdk1.4.1/bin/java" from the /usr/java/eclipse directory. 
Eclipse started fine, creating the "workspace" directory. I ran "chmod -R 777 
workspace" and now all users can run Eclipse.

There was definitely a problem with Eclipse 2.0 and Mandrake 8.2, but current 
releases of both run just fine together.

Closing.  I'm assuming that this was a setup problem since it works on our 
Mandrake 8.2, and it now works on Kevin's Mandrake 9.0.  The problem was 
probably related to permissions.

Prior permissions on /usr/java/eclipse was 777 recursive. Could have been too 
open, but definitely not too restrictive.
